newsitem.title: UK: Britain to launch inflation data inquiry-TV.
newsitem.headline: Britain to launch inflation data inquiry-TV.

text.p: Britain has launched an inquiry into the accuracy of its inflation figures, Channel 4 news said on Thursday.

It said the government was concerned that the present method might be over-estimating price rises. The television station quoted a statistics office spokesman as saying that the office was looking into "potential bias" in the figures. Upgrading of computers and cars were not being reflected in the figures, Channel 4 news said. Britain's core inflation stuck at 3.1 percent in January while the headline figure rose to 2.8 percent from 2.5.
